title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is calculated as a percentage of the annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. Adjustments are made in accordance with specific guidelines and do not continue after the comparability payment has been terminated or superseded. Contract appeals board members' pay rates are to be adjusted no less than 97 percent and 94 percent of the rate under paragraph (1). The rates will be adjusted by the President as appropriate based on adjustments in the General Schedule pay rates. The pay rates for contract appeals board members will be adjusted by the President as deemed appropriate. Amendments are made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, to reflect these adjustments. Amendments are made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments, limit certain payments for specific employees, and update references to level III of the executive schedule. Amendments are made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments, limit certain payments for specific employees, and update references to level III of the executive schedule. Provisions relating to certain offices and positions within the judicial branch are also addressed. Amendments are made to various sections of title 5, United States Code, to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments, limit certain payments for specific employees, and update references to level III of the executive schedule. Additionally, changes are made to positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, United States Code, circuit executives, and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts regarding maximum rates of basic pay allowable. Amendments to the Office of the United States Courts Personnel Act of 1990 involve changing levels from V to IV and IV to III in certain paragraphs. Additionally, the salary of the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts is adjusted from "district" to "circuit." The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
